alert.note: Alert for Columbia (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 8:28PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of western Massachusetts and east central New York, including the following counties, in western Massachusetts, Berkshire. In east central New York, Columbia. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 828 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsfield, Claverack, Livingston, New Lebanon, Clermont, Austerlitz, Philmont, Claverack-Red Mills, Ghent, Canaan, Taghkanic, Harlemville, Martindale, Pulvers, North Hillsdale, Spencertown, Craryville, Mellenville, Moorhouse Corner and Upper Hollowville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
